name: presumptively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to show that something is believed to be true, based on the information that is available : It seems that under the guidelines, the merger remains presumptively illegal. The disease was presumptively caused by his job.
More examplesFewer examplesGifts from businesses to Members of Parliament should be treated as presumptively fraudulent.In some areas, anyone who had a fever was presumptively treated for malaria.Any law that prohibits one type of speech while allowing another is presumptively unconstitutional.
